name: juniperus-chinensis-gold-star
particularly-resistant-to-insects/diseas: Resistant to root rot. This plant is particularly resistant to damage by deer and is moderately salt tolerant.
light: Full sun (6 or more hours of direct sunlight a day)
fruit-description: No true fruits, but female cones are blue, fleshy "berry" looking and edible, often used as a seasoning.
flower-description:
No flowers, but cones are large and brown 
and fall apart upon maturity.  Female cones are blue, fleshy "berry" looking.
leaf-description: Chartreuse-tipped bluish-green foliage which emerges yellow in spring. The leaves are highly ornamental and remain bluish-green throughout the winter.
